meanings.definition: A person who judges or decides on a disputed matter.
meanings.sent1: The adjudicator carefully considered both sides of the argument before making a decision.
meanings.sent2: The adjudicator declared the winner of the case after reviewing all the evidence.
meanings.sent3: The adjudicator couldn't help but chuckle at the amusing way the two parties presented their arguments.
meanings.sent4: She was like an impartial adjudicator, weighing the evidence on her scales of justice.
meanings.sent5: The adjudicator's gavel echoed through the courtroom, finalizing the verdict.

meanings.definition: A person who presides over a competition or contest and makes decisions on the outcome.
meanings.sent1: As the adjudicator of the dance competition, she had the important task of selecting the best performer.
meanings.sent2: The adjudicator awarded the trophy to the most talented singer in the competition.
meanings.sent3: The adjudicator raised an eyebrow at the comical dance moves of one of the contestants.
meanings.sent4: Like a skilled adjudicator, he carefully evaluated each participant's performance.
meanings.sent5: The adjudicator's decision determined who would take home the championship title.
